page.title: 12Gt. Mountains Farm
page.content: This is predominantly a pig farm with a stock of 1200.They are bred for slaughter and sold at local markets. A proportion are kept for breeding. Each sow produces an average of 10/12 piglets per litter.For the first three weeks they are kept under an infra-red light to maintain body heat. The weakest piglets,between 5/10lbs, are separated into a special sty and fed on a high protein/vitamin milk diet. A small proportion of winter beans, barley and wheat are grown. The farm is managed entirely by 3 members of the Frost family. JEPCRACK'S FARM This 250 acre farm is mainly arable, growing barley, wheat and oil seed rape. Most of the work is done by machine and employs 2 full time workers. It has 4 corn driers on site.
